<!-- Per MOS:BOLDTITLE and WP:SBE, neither the article's title nor related text appears in bold. -->On 21 November 2013 the roof of the Zolitūde shopping centre in the [[Zolitūde]] neighbourhood of [[Riga]], [[Latvia]], collapsed at 17:41 local time resulting in the deaths of 54 people, including three rescue workers, and injuries to another 41 people.<ref>{{cite web|title=Trīs Zolitūdē cietušie uzsāk rehabilitāciju, slimnīcās turpina ārstēties vēl 13|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106986-tris-zolitude-cietusie-uzsak-rehabilitaciju-slimnicas-turpina-arsteties-vel-13.htm|work=nra.lv|accessdate=3 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/109599-zolitudes-tragedija-54-cilvekiem-nave-iestajas-acumirkli.htm|title=Zolitūdes traģēdija: 54 cilvēkiem nāve iestājās acumirklī|last=Paparde|first=Inga|date=16 January 2014|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> An unknown number of people were able to leave the store on their own after the initial collapse.<ref name ="nra nelaime vienoti">{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106626-nelaime-vienoti.htm|title=Nelaimē vienoti|last=Šteinfelde|first=Ilze|date=25 November 2013|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref> It was the worst disaster in Latvia since 1950, when the steamer ''[[Mayakovsky (ship)|Mayakovsky]]'' sank in Riga, killing 147 people.<ref>{{cite news |script-title=ru:Как тонул "Маяковский" |language=Russian |trans-title=How the "Mayakovsky" sank |newspaper=ЧАС |publisher=Petits |location=Latvia |date=26 October 2005 |url=http://www.chas-daily.com/win/2005/10/26/g_056.html?r=32& |accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref>
==Building overview== The building, which contained a [[Maxima Group|Maxima]] supermarket and other businesses, was completed on 3 November 2011. Architectural design was by Zane Kalinka and Andris Kalinka from the local architectural firm KUBS. It was developed by Homburg Valda and built by the [[Re&Re]] company.<ref>{{cite news |title=Grocery Roof Collapse Kills 51 in Latvia |url= https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702303653004579213200159484692 |date=22 November 2013 |publisher=Wall Street Journal |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> When the building was finished, it won the Latvian Building of the Year award. Several months before its opening, a fire broke out in the market in which nobody was injured. At the time of the collapse, construction by Re&Re was taking place. The area of the shopping centre was {{convert|4750|m2|sqft|abbr=on}},<ref name="a4d">{{cite web |title=Maxima Zolitūdē |publisher=a4d.lv |date=23 November 2011 |url=http://www.a4d.lv/lv/projekti/maxima-zolitude/ |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> and the building cost around €1.4 million. The shopping centre was located in a part of the building owned by SIA Tineo,<ref>{{cite web |title=Maxima sniedz savu skaidrojumu par notikušo |language=Latvian |location=Latvia |publisher=BNN |url=http://bnn.lv/maxima-sniedz-savu-skaidrojumu-par-notikuso-125406 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Maxima: Signalizācija Zolitūdes veikalā ieslēgusies aptuveni 10 reizes; ēkas tehniskā pārbaude veikta šomēnes |language=Latvian |work=[[Diena]] |url= http://www.diena.lv/latvija/zinas/papildinats-12-46-maxima-signalizacija-zolitudes-veikala-ieslegusies-aptuveni-10-reizes-ekas-tehnisk-14033895 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> but it was originally owned by The Homburg Group, which still owns the adjacent apartment building.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ušakovs: Maxima grausts tiks nojaukts |language=Latvian |work=Diena |url= http://www.diena.lv/latvija/zinas/papildinats-15-18-usakovs-maxima-grausts-tiks-nojaukts-14033968 |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> Tineo is an [[offshore company]] owned by the Maxima group, a retail chain with operations mostly in the [[Baltic states]], which owns the "Maxima XX" supermarket in the building. The company initially claimed it was a tenant of the building.<ref>{{cite news |title=Zolitūdē sagruvušais veikals tomēr pieder "Maxima" grupai |language=Latvian |publisher=tvnet.lv |date=25 November 2013 |url= http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/487624-zolitude_sagruvusais_veikals_tomer_pieder_maxima_grupai |accessdate=26 November 2013}}</ref> The building also contained a bank, a beauty salon, a currency exchange, a newsagent's and a pet shop. There were plans for a layer of [[topsoil]] {{convert|20|-|30|cm}} thick on the roof; small recreational spots with benches, connected by cobblestone-paved paths, were planned for the resident of an apartment house that was part of the same complex.<ref name="a4d"/> Before the collapse, construction of the green roof was in progress, as was construction of underground car parking in the basement, intended for residents of the building.<ref>{{cite news |title="Maxima": Pēc signalizācijas atskanēšanas draudi cilvēku dzīvībai netika konstatēti |language=Latvian |work=Nozare |date=22 November 2013 |url=http://www.nozare.lv/business/top/B31B1B11-7EBA-48F0-B28C-2BEEC4A04BCB/ |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>
==Collapse == [[File:First hours after Maxima roof collapse..jpg|thumb|Rescuers gathered near the entrance of the store]] Eyewitnesses said that at around 16:21 a fire alarm was set off and there were announcements made that the store should be evacuated. Security personnel verified this to be related to welding construction in the basement and switched off the alarm. It was later reported that the owner of the company which had installed the alarm said that it was designed to detect fire emergencies. He said it is unlikely that the alarm was set off by dust from the roof starting to collapse, as it was set off near water pipes in the basement. The store's security verified that there was no fire and therefore did not carry out an evacuation, but rather treated it as a false alarm and called a technician to turn it off. The building collapsed shortly after the technician arrived and he was not able to verify why the alarm had gone off.<ref>{{cite news |title=Kāpēc ignorēja trauksmes signalizāciju? |language=Latvian |publisher=lsm.lv |date=22 November 2013 |url=http://www.lsm.lv/lv/analize/zinju-analiize/kapec-ignoreja-trauksmes-signalizaciju.a70538/ |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> A board member of "Maxima Latvija" said that security had followed protocol, which was not to evacuate if there was no visible danger.<ref>{{cite news |title=Traģēdija 'Maxima': cilvēki netika evakuēti no veikala, jo nebija acīmredzamu ugunsgrēka pazīmju |language=Latvian |agency=BNS |location=Latvia |publisher=Delfi.lv |date=2013-11-22 |url= http://www.delfi.lv/news/national/politics/tragedija-maxima-cilveki-netika-evakueti-no-veikala-jo-nebija-acimredzamu-ugunsgreka-pazimju.d?id=43839030 |accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref> According to some reports, the smaller shops in the retail centre, unlike Maxima, were evacuated and closed.<ref>{{cite news |script-title=ru:ЧП в Золитуде: 53 погибших, трое из них — спасатели |language=Russian |trans-title=Emergency situation in Zolitūde: 53 perished, three of them rescuers |location=Latvia |publisher=rus.delfi.lv |date=2013-11-21 |url= http://rus.delfi.lv/news/daily/criminal/chp-v-zolitude-53-pogibshih-troe-iz-nih-spasateli.d?id=43837110 |accessdate=2013-11-29}}</ref> Many customers, however, stayed in the store, encouraged by the calm demeanor of Maxima's employees. Some employees of the smaller shops also started returning to their workplaces after being told by security that it was a false alarm. It has also been reported by witnesses that at around 17:00 the alarm was turned off.<ref name="ir zarks"/>
The roof caved in at 17:41 local time. Because the collapse occurred during peak shopping hours, it was suspected that at least a hundred people may have been in the store during the collapse. Eyewitnesses said the roof collapsed over the [[Point of sale|checkout counters]], where many people were waiting to pay, and over the dairy, alcoholic beverage and [[household chemicals]] sections.<ref name="ir zarks">{{cite news|title=Nevainīgais zārks|last=Puķe|first=Ieva|author2=Anita Brauna |date=28 November 2013|publisher=Ir|pages=14–20}}</ref> This was confirmed by police who released a map based on CCTV footage just before the collapse.<ref>{{cite news |title=Veikala karte. Kuras teritorijas vēl jāpārmeklē |language=Latvian |publisher=ltv.lv |date=19 November 2013 |url= http://www.ltv.lv/lv/raksts/23.11.2013-veikala-karte.-kuras-teritorijas-vel-japarmekle.id20928/ |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> It was later reported that the collapse started over counters 6, 7 and 8. There were more than 50 employees working in the various stores in the building and an uncertain number of customers that might have been in the building, many of whom were able to escape before rescuers arrived.<ref name ="nra nelaime vienoti"/> Most of the store lost electrical power due to damage caused by the collapse, which resulted in the main door locking and trapping several people inside the store, people had to break the glass to escape.<ref name="ir zarks"/> The roof fell into the building, and also onto several cars parked outside the store.
The firefighters, ambulances and police arrived at the scene within minutes. After the initial collapse, firefighters divided the building into four working areas. Although it had initially seemed that the remaining roof construction posed no further danger, at 19:04 another part of the roof collapsed over one of the previously designated work areas, trapping several [[firefighter]]s, injuring twelve and killing three of them.<ref name="VUGD nepatiesibas">{{cite news|url=http://www.delfi.lv/news/zolitudes-tragedija/tragedija-zolitude-vugd-atspeko-dazas-nepatiesibas.d?id=43856412|title=Traģēdija Zolitūdē: VUGD atspēko dažas nepatiesības|date=28 November 2013|publisher=delfi.lv|accessdate=29 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title="Maximas" traģēdijas notikumu hronoloģija |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=25 November 2013 |url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106620-maximas-tragedijas-notikumu-hronologija.htm |accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |script-title=ru:ЧП в Золитуде: пострадали более 30 человек, 47 погибших, трое из них — спасатели (09.04) |language=Russian |trans-title=Emergency situation in Zolitūde: More than 30 injured, 47 dead, three of them rescuers (09:04) |location=Latvia |publisher=rus.delfi.lv |date=2013-11-21 |url= http://rus.delfi.lv/news/daily/criminal/chp-v-zolitude-postradali-bolee-30-chelovek-32-pogibshih-troe-iz-nih-spasateli-0904.d?id=43837110 |accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref><ref name="diena">{{cite news|title=papildināts (09:45) – Maxima traģēdijā 25 bojāgājušie un 40 izglābtie; drupās aizvien dzirdami telefonu zvani |language=Latvian |newspaper=Diena |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.diena.lv/latvija/zinas/papildinats-09-45-maxima-tragedija-25-bojagajusie-un-40-izglabtie-drupas-aizvien-dzirdami-telefonu-z-14033795 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> By that time 20 people – most of those injured in the first collapse – had been rescued.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/489121-lidz_otrajam_nobrukam_maxima_vugd_izglaba_20_cilveku_lielako_dalu_izdzivojuso|title= Līdz otrajam nobrukumam Maximā VUGD izglāba 20 cilvēku – lielāko daļu izdzīvojušo|date=5 December 2013|publisher=tvnet.lv|accessdate=28 December 2013}}</ref> The injured were transferred to the [[Pauls Stradins Clinical University Hospital]], the Riga East Clinical university hospital, the Riga Second hospital, and the Traumatology and Orthopedic hospital. One child was transferred to the Clinical University Hospital for children.
Both before and after the second collapse, only firefighters were allowed to enter the building, and anyone inside was pulled out and brought to the ambulances parked just outside the store. After the second collapse, it was reported that only five firefighters were allowed to enter the building at a time, and that the rest were forced to wait outside because of the danger of further collapse.<ref name="VUGD priekshnieks"/> Each firefighter was allowed to spend only half an hour working. Bulldozers were used to clear the rubble. Mobile [[Crane (machine)|crane]]s were deployed at 21:27 to lift concrete slabs.<ref name="VUGD nepatiesibas"/>
According to a Latvian army tweet, 110 soldiers were on site on 21 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/Latvijas_armija/status/403643688095457280|title=NBS twitter channel|date=21 November 2013|publisher=@Latvijas_armija|accessdate=29 December 2013}}</ref> Several tents were installed for the use of firefighters and ambulance workers by the military. Latvia was offered aid by several countries, however it was turned down as State and fire rescue service believed they already had the required manpower, equipment and experience for the rescue operation.<ref name="VUGD nepatiesibas"/>
At least one silent period was used to listen for signs of life among the rubble; some cell phones were heard ringing.<ref name="VUGD priekshnieks">{{cite news |title=VUGD priekšnieks: Glābšanas darbi varētu turpināties vēl vismaz diennakti |language=Latvian |newspaper=Diena |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.diena.lv/latvija/riga/vugd-prieksnieks-glabsanas-darbi-varetu-turpinaties-vel-vismaz-diennakti-14033867 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> The use of thermal scanners and [[Search and rescue dog]]s was also tried, however this proved unsuccessful as concrete rubble was too thick to detect warmth and dogs were distracted by the strong scent of household chemicals and alcohol that had leaked from broken packing.<ref name="VUGD nepatiesibas"/>
Another fireman was reported to have been injured during clearing of the rubble in the early hours of 23 November.<ref>{{cite news |title=No sabrukušās "Maximas" ar acs traumu slimnīcā nogādāts glābējs |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=23 November 2013 |url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106510-no-sabrukusas-maximas-ar-acs-traumu-slimnica-nogadats-glabejs.htm |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>
Another collapse occurred at 17:52 on 23 November.<ref>{{cite news |last=McGuinness |first=Damien |title=Remaining section of Latvia supermarket roof collapses |format=video |publisher=BBC News |date=23 November 2013 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-25069941 |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> None of the rescuers were harmed in this subsequent collapse.<ref>{{cite news |title=Zolitūdes "Maximā" noticis vēl viens nobrukums |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=23 November 2013 |url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106547-zolitudes-maxima-noticis-vel-viens-nobrukums.htm |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> As the third collapse compromised the structural integrity of the roof, rescue efforts were stopped at around 19:00, A representative of the paramedics said that, given the severity of injuries the bodies of the latest victims had, they had no hope anyone else might still be alive.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pārtrauc glābšanas darbus; vairs nav cerību atrast izdzīvojušos |language=Latvian |publisher=nra |date=23 November 2013 |url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106551-partrauc-glabsanas-darbus-vairs-nav-ceribu-atrast-izdzivojusos.htm |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>
The rescue was restarted the following afternoon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Glābēji atsāk darbu lielveikala "Maxima" gruvešos vietā, kur varētu būt cilvēki |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=24 November 2013 |url= http://nra.lv/latvija/106599-glabeji-atsak-darbu-lielveikala-maxima-gruvesos-vieta-kur-varetu-but-cilveki.htm |accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref> There were no more victims found in the rubble and rescue work was finished on 25 November.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pabeigti meklēšanas darbi sabrukušā veikala teritorijā; jaunus bojāgājušos neatrod |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=25 November 2013 |url= http://nra.lv/latvija/106665-pabeigti-meklesanas-darbi-sabrukusa-veikala-teritorija-jaunus-bojagajusos-neatrod.htm |accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref>
[[File:Maxima Riga 1.jpg|thumb|Candles and flowers in memory of the victims. The rubble can be seen in the background.]]
The fatalities have been identified as 51 citizens of Latvia,<ref name="voiceofrussia1">{{cite web |url= http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2013_11_23/Riga-supermarket-collapse-death-toll-reaches-53-people-rescuers-have-150-m-2-of-debris-left-to-be-combed-9220/ |title=Riga supermarket collapse death toll reaches 53 people, rescuers have 150 m 2 of debris left to be combed |work=The Voice of Russia |date=23 November 2013 |accessdate=24 November 2013}}</ref><ref>http://www.baltictimes.com/news/articles/33833/</ref> 2 citizens of Russia<ref name="rt-1">[http://rt.com/news/riga-mall-collapse-latvia-118/ At least 53 dead after Latvia mall collapse (PHOTOS, VIDEO)]. [[RT (TV network)|RT]]. 21 November 2013.</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Two Russia nationals killed in Riga supermarket collapse – Latvian Foreign Ministry |publisher=[[Voice of Russia]] |location=Russia |url= http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2013_11_23/Two-Russia-nationals-killed-in-Riga-supermarket-collapse-Latvian-Foreign-Ministry-2209/ |accessdate=23 November 2013 |date=23 November 2013}}</ref> and 1 citizen of Armenia.<ref>{{cite news |title=Armenian citizen reported among victims in Latvia trade center collapse |newspaper=[[ArmeniaNow]] |date=22 November 2013 |url=http://www.armenianow.com/news/50296/armenia_riga_supermarket_collapse_armenian_citizen_dead |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
==Aftermath== After the disaster, the Mayor of Riga [[Nils Ušakovs]] gave an order to inspect all building projects carried out by Re&Re.<ref>{{cite news |last=Petrane |first=Lelde |title=Atjaunots – Pēc traģēdijas Ušakovs liek pārbaudīt visus Re&Rebūvobjektus; visticamāk, pārbaudīs arī Gaismas pili |language=Latvian |publisher=LETA |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.db.lv/foto-video/foto/atjaunots-pec-tragedijas-usakovs-liek-parbaudit-visus-re-re-buvobjektus-visticamak-parbaudis-ari-gai-405468 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
The developer of the apartment building put additional construction on hold.<ref>{{Cite news |script-title=ru:Кому принадлежит здание рухнувшего торгового центра в Золитуде? |language=Russian |trans-title=Who owns the building of the collapsed shopping centre in Zolitūde? |location=Latvia |publisher=Delfi |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.lv/biznes/bnews/komu-prinadlezhit-zdanie-ruhnuvshego-torgovogo-centra-v-zolitude.d?id=43839572 |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> The apartment building itself was not damaged in the incident.<ref>{{cite news |script-title=ru:Девелопер "замораживает" стройку жилой многоэтажки рядом с рухнувшим торговым центром |language=Russian |trans-title=Developer "freezes" construction of residential apartment buildings near collapsed shopping centre |location=Latvia |publisher=DELFI |url= http://www.delfi.lv/biznes/bnews/developer-zamorazhivaet-strojku-zhiloj-mnogoetazhki-ryadom-s-ruhnuvshim-torgovym-centrom.d?id=43840720 |date=22 November 2013}}</ref>
Maxima agreed to pay compensation to the victims and families of the dead.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sabet-Parry |first=Rayyan |title=LATEST: Rescue mission comes to an end at supermarket collapse site |location=RIGA, Latvia |publisher=Baltictimes.com |date=24 November 2013 |url=http://www.baltictimes.com/news/articles/33818/#.UpPzGcTIZ2k |accessdate=2013-11-26}}</ref>
==Investigation and cause== The inquiry into the collapse began just minutes after it occurred. The police investigated three theories: first, that there was an error in [[structural design]], and authorities overseeing planning had been negligent; second, that the cause is related to initial building procedures; third, that it was caused by the construction of the green roof.<ref name="rt-1"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Policijai trīs versijas par negadījuma iemesliem |language=Latvian |publisher=lsm.lv |date=22 November 2013 |url=http://www.lsm.lv/lv/zinas/latvija/policijai-triis-versijas-par-negadiijuma-iemesliem.a70485/ |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
In a related case on 27 February 2014 a man was fined for [[signature forgery]] on documents related to construction works in 2011. The police announced this finding in March, but did not disclose any further information.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/kriminalzinas/500699-zolitudes_tragedijas_lieta_atklaj_viltotus_buvniecibas_dokumentus|title= Zolitūdes traģēdijas lietā atklāj viltotus būvniecības dokumentus|date=10 March 2014|publisher=tvnet.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref> [[Latvian Television]] ran a report in April alleging that the person fined was owner of a now liquidated company MONCE – a subcontractor hired to install the metal constructions of the building by the manufacturer of the constructions Vikom Industry. Instead of hiring a certified building engineer to oversee the installation, the company had forged the documents using the name of an engineer, whom they previously had offered a job and paid him a salary of 5.95 [[Latvian lat|lats]] from January to April 2011, which he actually never received.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ltv.lv/lv/raksts/20.04.2014-oficialais-darbu-vadiitajs-zolitude-nav-stradajis.id28069/|title=Oficiālais darbu vadītājs Zolitūdē nav strādājis|date=20 April 2014|publisher=LTV|language=Latvian|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref>
The investigation of the cause of collapse was hindered by the collapsed building still being unsafe to enter.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/108308-policija-atskaitas-ko-paveikusi-menesa-laika-pec-maximas-tragedijas.htm|title=Policija atskaitās, ko paveikusi mēneša laikā pēc "Maximas" traģēdijas|date=20 December 2013|publisher=nra.lv|accessdate=28 December 2013}}</ref> The remaining constructions were reinforced by March 2014. From April 2014, investigators were finally able to enter the building, where they recovered evidence buried by the third collapse of the roof and carried out investigation experiments – a controlled collapse of the remaining section of the roof and controlled fires, to test what loads the roof could carry and if the building's structures could have been compromised in the fire which occurred during its construction.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/506153-zolitudes_veikala_maxima_konstrukcijas_brucinasana|title=Zolitūdes veikala "Maxima" konstrukcijas brucināšana|date=15 April 2014|publisher=Tvnet|language=Latvian|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> The preliminary findings from the controlled collapse, which took place from 14 April to 17 April showed prolonged deformation of the metal support structures, which started well before the target weight of the roof was reached and ended with the constructions eventually breaking, suggesting that the roof was built improperly and the actual collapse was not caused by a sudden change, but by overloading structures for a prolonged period of time and possibly [[metal fatigue]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/506415-eksperimenta_zolitudes_lielveikala_jumta_konstrukcijas_parluzusas|title= Eksperimentā Zolitūdes lielveikala jumta konstrukcijas pārlūzušas|date=17 April 2014|publisher=tvnet|language=Latvian|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/viedokli/506197-generalprokurors_pielautas_butiskas_kludas_maxima_jumta_izbuve|title= Ģenerālprokurors: pieļautas būtiskas kļūdas "Maxima" jumta izbūvē|date=16 April 2014|publisher=tvnet|language=Latvian|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref> Two controlled fires were set on 27 May. The police did not disclose preliminary results of this experiment and said that they aim to complete investigation in late fall.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.diena.lv/latvija/zinas/fotoreportaza-ar-dumu-mutuliem-divos-piegajienos-nosledzas-eksperiments-zolitudes-tragedijas-vieta-14057267|title=Ar dūmu mutuļiem divos piegājienos noslēdzas eksperiments Zolitūdes traģēdijas vietā|last=Kincis|first=Jānis|date=27 May 2014|publisher=Diena|language=Latvian|accessdate=10 June 2014}}</ref> On 10 June 2014 it was announced that a separate criminal inquiry has been launched to verify findings of State Labour Inspectorate, which reported [[Occupational safety and health|work safety]] violations in Maxima.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/kriminalzinas/513816-zolitudes_tragedijas_lieta_sak_vel_vienu_kriminalprocesu|title=Zolitūdes traģēdijas lietā sāk vēl vienu kriminālprocesu|date=10 June 2014|publisher=LETA/TVNET|language=Latvian|accessdate=10 June 2014}}</ref> The police concluded investigation on the site on 28 July 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/kriminalzinas/519721-valsts_policija_pabeidz_izmeklesanu_un_no_sodienas_atstaj_zolitudes_tragedijas_teritoriju|title= Valsts policija pabeidz izmeklēšanu un no šodienas atstāj Zolitūdes traģēdijas teritoriju|date=28 July 2014|publisher=tvnet|language=Latvian|accessdate=28 July 2014}}</ref>
In January 2015 the first suspects were named – construction engineer Ivars Sergets, design expert Andris Gulbis and architect Andris Kalinka. In addition the assets of HND Grupa (a company owned by Sergets) and Kubs (owned by Kalinka and his sister) were frozen. It is unclear what the architect is suspected for as both the investigators and his representatives refused to comment. Sergets is suspected of making an error in the designs of the building's roof constructions. Gulbis is suspected of negligence as he was supposed to inspect and approve the design, but failed to notice the error. Prosecutor general Ēriks Kalnmeiers cautioned that the investigation is still ongoing and there will be more suspects. He said that the way the building was designed meant it was bound to collapse, however, the investigation had uncovered other factors that contributed to the collapse occurring at a particular time and therefore resulting in deaths, as well as numerous unrelated violations, which speak of a general tendency to disregard regulations, therefore everyone who had been neglectful contributed to the accident and should be held responsible.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maximalietas pirmais izrāviens|last=Mače|first=Zane|date=22 January 2015|publisher=Ir|pages=18–21|language=Latvian}}</ref>
=== Initial speculations on the cause=== According to Re & Re's preliminary report, the cause was likely a design error. The report is a result of three independent civil engineers' examination of the project documentation. The rooftop garden was included in the original design, but the building was still "designed with insufficient load carrying capacity, three times less than required". The report states that the main reasons for the collapse are faulty estimation of the maximum load to be carried by the roof, and the design of the connections in the structural steel supporting the roof.<ref>{{cite news |title=Design fault likely caused Latvia roof cave-in |publisher=www.globalpost.com |date=29 November 2013 |url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/afp/131129/design-fault-likely-caused-latvia-roof-cave|accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Re&Re engineers: Zolitude disaster was due to erroneous calculations of maximum loads |publisher=www.baltic-course.com |date=29 November 2013 |url=http://www.baltic-course.com/eng/real_estate/?doc=84380|accessdate=30 November 2013}}</ref>
According to Ivars Sergets, the owner of the HND Grupa which was responsible for the construction of the building, the collapse may have been caused by overload, created by materials being loaded onto weaker points of the roof. He rejected the possibility that the disaster had been caused by the design of the garden, since the store had been operating for two winters and the stress created by the weight of snow had been up to twice as great as the stress caused by the garden at the time of the collapse. He pointed out that too many of the building materials were stored on the roof.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sabrukušajā lielveikalā līdz šim atrasti 47 bojāgājušie: Teksta tiešraide |location=Latvia |publisher=apollo |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.apollo.lv/zinas/sabrukusaja-lielveikala-lidz-sim-atrasti-45-bojagajusie-teksta-tiesraide/623454 |accessdate=21 November 2013}}</ref> Later on, however, he admitted that trusses made of two pieces bolted together were used, while the original design called for a single truss. This was a result of issues with transporting longer trusses to the building site.<ref>{{cite news|title=Būvkompānija atzīst, ka sākotnējais sagruvušā "Maxima" jumta projekts mainīts |language=Latvian |publisher=nra.lv |date=24 November 2013 |url= http://nra.lv/latvija/106598-buvkompanija-atzist-ka-sakotnejais-sagruvusa-maxima-jumta-projekts-mainits.htm |accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref>
Lilita Ozola, an engineer teaching at the Latvian University of Agriculture, suggested that for changing the trusses the entire design plan should have been revised and reapproved by authorities. With the two-piece trusses installed, the joint between them would bear most of the roof's weight. She pointed out that there is a video recording of the shopping centre's roof collapsing in which it is obvious that it failed at the exact position of the joints. She also criticised construction work taking place on the roof when there were people in the building.<ref>{{cite news |title=Traģēdijas vainīgos var atklāt! |language=Latvian |publisher=tvnet.lv |date=26 November 2013 |url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/viedokli/487638-tragedijas_vainigos_var_atklat |accessdate=25 November 2013}}</ref>
Toomas Kaljas, who claims to be a [[structural engineer]] working for a Finnish company, has published research based on photographs from the site, suggesting the connections between the horizontal bars that held the roof were inadequately designed. The garden on the roof played a minimal role. The load on the [[screw|bolts]] that were holding the bars was uneven and there were too few of them. The calculations of forces applied to bolts were wrong. A better design would have resulted in components bending and cracking over time, instead of the whole building suddenly collapsing like [[dominoes]] without warning.<ref name="arileht.delfi.ee">{{cite news |title=Insener: Riia kaubanduskeskus oli nagu rotilõks, hoone oli valesti projekteeritud ja tugevusarvutused olid valed |language=Estonian |trans-title=Engineer: The mall was like a rat trap, the building was wrongly designed and durability calculations were wrong |work=Ärileht |publisher=Delfi |location=Estonia |date=24 November 2013 |url= http://arileht.delfi.ee/news/uudised/insener-riia-kaubanduskeskus-oli-nagu-rotiloks-hoone-oli-valesti-projekteeritud-ja-tugevusarvutused-olid-valed.d?id=67149494 |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref><ref name="postimees.ee_2608210">{{cite news |title=Insener Riia kaubanduskeskuse varingust: odav arvutiprogramm ei asenda häid insenere |language=Estonian |trans-title=Engineer on Riga mall collapse: A cheap computer program does not supplant good engineers |publisher=[[Postimees]] |location=Estonia |date=24 November 2013 |url= http://www.postimees.ee/2608210/insener-riia-kaubanduskeskuse-varingust-odav-arvutiprogramm-ei-asenda-haid-insenere |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref> Kaljas tested some [[Nut (hardware)|nuts]] which were built to meet [[Deutsches Institut für Normung|DIN 934]] standard and which, according to him, are available in any hardware store. He found that these are not strong enough.{{clarify||reason=Were the bolts not as strong as they should be (manufacturing fault) or were the bolts used too weak for the purpose (human error)?|date=December 2013}} A solution would have been to either get stronger nuts, or place two of them on the end of the same bolt. According to Toomas, the building designer should have issued a standard for the required nuts or, if not, then the builders should have asked for it. He thinks all public buildings that use these bolts should get additional nuts. <ref name="delfi.ee_67373446">{{cite news |title=Insener Toomas Kaljas: Riia kaubanduskeskuse lae nõrgim lüli oli mutter, tragöödiat oleks saanud vältida |language=Estonian |trans-title=Engineer Toomas Kaljas: The weak spot of the Riga mall roof was the nuts and the disaster could have been avoided. |location=Estonia |publisher=Delfi |date=3 December 2013 |url=http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/eesti/insener-toomas-kaljas-riia-kaubanduskeskuse-lae-norgim-luli-oli-mutter-tragoodiat-oleks-saanud-valtida.d?id=67373446|accessdate=2013-12-03}}</ref> Latvian state police has called in question competence of Kaljas stating that he was not able to produce his credentials. It is also speculated that he is connected with Vikom Industry, although he himself has denied it.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/107777-maximas-tragedijas-somu-eksperts-izradas-nav-nekads-eksperts.htm|title="Maximas" traģēdijas somu eksperts izrādās nav nekāds eksperts|date=12 December 2013|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=12 December 2013}}</ref>
According to a press representative of Kubs, the architect bureau that designed the building, the possibly faulty metal joint components were supplied by Vikom Industry. The management at Vikom Industry had said that they were unable to provide single-piece components and offered components that would be assembled out of two halves, but which would be just as strong as the ones ordered. Therefore, according to Kubs, Vikom Industry is solely responsible for the component and bolt force and strength calculations. Vladislavs Podgurskis, a representative of Vikom Industry, said in response that all metal components were made and assembled strictly according to the building design and that it must be a design error.<ref name="delfi.ee_67153842">{{cite news |title=Riia poe projekteerijad Delfile: katastroofi põhjuste osas tasub vaadata metallitehase poole |language=Estonian |trans-title=Designers of the Riga store to Delfi: One should look at the metal plant as to the reasons of the disaster |location=Estonia |publisher=Delfi |date=25 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/valismaa/riia-poe-projekteerijad-delfile-katastroofi-pohjuste-osas-tasub-vaadata-metallitehase-poole.d?id=67153842 |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref>
Vikom Industry said the bolts for joining the trusses had been supplied by the Eurobolts company. On 25 November Vikom Industry requested a manufacturer's certificate from Eurobolts for a certain batch of bolts. The owner and CEO of Eurobolts, Olga Romanova, said that the company has no information on what the bolts they sell are used for, however, the bolts in the batch Vikom Industry was interested in were not strong enough for joining trusses for the roof and that Vikom Industry had in fact never bought bolts that would be strong enough for that purpose. She added that judging from photographs of the trusses on the scene of the incident even smaller bolts were used. An anonymous fireman told TV3 News that the bolts he had seen on scene had not been broken, rather pulled out from fastenings, indicating the bolts were not designed for bearing the weight of the roof.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pieprasīti skrūvju ražotāja sertifikāti pirms trīs gadiem pirktām skrūvēm |language=Latvian |publisher=tvnet.lv |date=26 November 2013 |url= http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/487817-pieprasiti_skruvju_razotaja_sertifikati_pirms_tris_gadiem_pirktam_skruvem |accessdate=26 November 2013}}</ref>
The vice director of the Latvian Fire Safety and Civil Defence College, Vilis Students, who participated in the rescue work, said that the concrete components seemed unexpectedly fragile. Translated quote: "''I am no specialist, but we could break the roof components with hammers and pliers. During exercises with concrete objects, we usually had to use a [[jackhammer]].''"<ref name="delfi.ee_67153120">{{cite news |title=Päästja: kaubanduskeskuse betoonkonstruktsioonid olid kahtlaselt haprad |language=Estonian |trans-title=Rescuer: The concrete components of the mall were suspiciously fragile |publisher=Delfi |location=Estonia |date=25 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/valismaa/paastja-kaubanduskeskuse-betoonkonstruktsioonid-olid-kahtlaselt-haprad.d?id=67153120 |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref>
According to Maxima staff, the building had been dangerously unstable for about a year. The construction workers had told them that the [[Foundation (engineering)|foundation]] was cracked and needed reinforcement. At one point the storage room and store workers' locker room was completely flooded. There had also been extra support columns under the ceiling of the storage room, but those had been removed later. The fire alarm sounded frequently. The staff believe that the reason for the alarm was that it was obsolete and could not distinguish smoke from dust. The workers did not want to testify about this in front of a camera because they feared for their jobs.<ref name="postimees.ee_2608880">{{cite news |title=Riia Maxima töötajad: hoones oli defekte juba ammu |language=Estonian |trans-title=Riga Maxima employees: There were defects in the building for a long while |agency=TVNET/DIENA/PM |location=Estonia |publisher=Postimees |date=25 November 2013 |url=http://www.postimees.ee/2608880/riia-maxima-tootajad-hoones-oli-defekte-juba-ammu |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref><ref name="delfi.ee_67153296">{{cite news |title=Riia Maxima töötajad: hoonega oli juba ammu midagi viltu |language=Estonian |trans-title=Riga Maxima employees: Something was wrong with the building for a long while |location=Estonia |publisher=Delfi |date=25 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/valismaa/riia-maxima-tootajad-hoonega-oli-juba-ammu-midagi-viltu.d?id=67153296 |accessdate=2013-11-28}}</ref>
== Political reaction == On 23 November, [[President of Latvia|Latvian President]] [[Andris Bērziņš (Latvian President)|Andris Bērziņš]] stated that the collapse was a "murder of defenseless people" and that the "perpetrators should be arrested", and that the inquiry needed independent experts from other countries who are not associated with Latvian builders in any possible way. He also said that the entire political system needs to be changed as it allows individuals to escape responsibility.<ref>{{cite news |title=Президент: трагедия в Maxima — массовое убийство |language=Russian |location=Latvia |url= http://rus.delfi.lv/news/daily/latvia/prezident-tragediya-v-maxima-massovoe-ubijstvo.d?id=43841544 |date=23 November 2013 |publisher=DELFI |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref> The BBC News Riga correspondent reported that the president wanted a criminal investigation "led by independent investigators from abroad – implying that powerful business interests in Latvia are too closely entwined with politics to ensure a fair and honest investigation."<ref>{{cite news |last=McGuinness |first=Damien |title=Latvia president calls supermarket collapse 'murder' |publisher=BBC News |date=23 November 2013 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-25068291 |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>
[[Prime Minister of Latvia|Latvian Prime Minister]] [[Valdis Dombrovskis]] resigned on 27 November. He said that the country needed strong government with support in parliament at the moment of crisis and that he was thus taking responsibility for the incident.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/487961-valdis_dombrovskis_pazino_par_atkapsanos_no_amata |title=Valdis Dombrovskis paziņo par atkāpšanos no amata |date=27 November 2013 |publisher=tvnet.lv |language=Latvian |accessdate=27 November 2013}}</ref> He also said he had considered this in the days after the tragedy and had made a final decision during a meeting with the president, but denied the president had asked him to step down.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.delfi.lv/news/national/politics/dombrovskis-uznemas-atbildibu-par-tragediju-zolitude-krit-valdiba-teksta-tiesraide.d?id=43851844 |title=Dombrovskis uzņemas atbildību par traģēdiju Zolitūdē – krīt valdība |date=27 November 2013 |publisher=delfi.lv |language=Latvian |accessdate=27 November 2013}}</ref> Opinion polls indicate that most people want mayor of Riga [[Nils Ušakovs]] to also step down.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/viedokli/487980-usakovam_jaatkapjas_no_amata |title=Ušakovam jāatkāpjas no amata! |date=27 November 2013 |publisher=tvnet.lv |language=Latvian |accessdate=27 November 2013}}</ref> As political commentator Aivars Ozoliņš points out, since the Riga city council controls the local building authority responsible for the quality of buildings in Riga it was Ušakovs, not Dombrovskis, who should have taken political responsibility for the incident. Soon after the collapse several experts cited abolishing state building inspection among the reasons why control over building processes has lessened. This was done as a result of budget cuts during the global economic crisis as it was thought that municipal building authorities perform the same tasks. This was done in 2009 by the government of Valdis Dombrovskis. Ušakovs has cited this as the reason why the government of Dombrovskis was responsible; however he himself was a member of the [[Saeima]] when this decision was made and supported it in parliament.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/487789-rigas_mers_savulaik_pats_balsojis_par_valsts_buvinspekcijas_likvidesanu |title=Rīgas mērs savulaik pats balsojis par Valsts būvinspekcijas likvidēšanu |date=26 November 2013 |publisher=tvnet.lv |language=Latvian |accessdate=27 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.delfi.lv/news/comment/comment/aivars-ozolins-ir-atkapies-usakov.d?id=43854040#ixzz2lwozmRdg |title=Aivars Ozoliņš, 'Ir': Atkāpies, Ušakov! |last=Ozoliņš |first=Aivars |date=28 November 2013 |publisher=delfi.lv |language=Latvian |accessdate=28 November 2013}}</ref>
The incident also caused some tension between Latvia and [[Lithuania]] after the top management of the Lithuanian-owned chain refused to take any responsibility for the incident. In particular, the CEO of Maxima Latvija, Gintaras Jasinskas, when asked if he had considered stepping down like Dombrovskis, caused outrage by saying "Why? Those who feel guilty should step down. I can look people in the eye". This was condemned by several Latvian politicians and the Latvian Ministry of Foreign Affairs called the Lithuanian ambassador to express official condemnation. Jasinskas was sacked and Lithuania expressed regret over his actions.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvnet.lv/zinas/latvija/488207-maxima_latvija_vaditajs_jasinsks_atlaists_no_amata|title= "Maxima Latvija" vadītājs Jasinsks atlaists no amata|date=28 November 2013|publisher=tvnet.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=1 December 2013}}</ref>
== Parliamentary investigation == [[File:Zolitudes parlamentaras izmeklesanas komisijas 23 03 2015 sede.jpg|thumb|300 px|right|Saeima's Zolitūde tragedy investigatory committee meeting on 23 March 2015]]
On 11 November 2014 members of the 12th convocation of Saeima, at the request of 36 deputies, voted in favour of establishing the Zolitūde tragedy parliamentary investigatory committee.{{efn|The full name of the Committee is ”Parliamentary Committee for Investigating the Actions Taken by the State of Latvia in Assessing the Causes of the Tragedy in Zolitūde on 21 November 2013, Improving the Legislative Framework and Practical Measures to be Taken by the Public Administration and Municipalities in Order to Prevent Recurrence of Similar Tragedies, as well as Mitigating the Consequences of the Tragedy”.}}<ref name=SP>{{cite web|title=Par parlamentārās izmeklēšanas|trans-title=Parliamentary Inquiry|publisher=[[Saeima]]|url=http://likumi.lv/ta/id/270273-par-parlamentaras-izmeklesanas-komisijas-izveidosanu-par-latvijas-valsts-ricibu-izvertejot-2013-gada-21-novembri-zolitude}}</ref> The committee was appointed for the period of 12 months<ref name=SP/> to investigate the actions taken by the state of Latvia in assessing the causes of the tragedy as well as measures taken by the government to prevent the recurrence of similar tragedies and mitigate the consequences of the tragedy.
The committee devoted most of its attention to issues in the construction sector of the economy, including state and municipal supervision of the construction sector (especially the dissolution of the State Construction Inspection Office and the creation of the National Construction Control Agency), quality of construction engineering education and the certification system, public procurement in construction sector, supervision of the market of construction materials and other questions. Addressing issues related to civil defence and social assistance, the committee in its sittings examined the following topics: competence of the employees of the security company ; cooperation between rescue services and municipalities in emergency situations, coordination of emergency response and mitigation of accident impact, resources of the responsible services; involvement of non-government organisations in emergency situations, in organizing social support; emergency social care package offered by the state and municipalities, and other topics.<ref>Zolitūdes traģēdijas parlamentārās izmeklēšanas komisijas sēžu protokli Nr. 5.-19., http://zolitude.saeima.lv/komisijas-sezu-protokoli</ref>
The final report of the committee was adopted on the committee meeting on 27 October 2015 and has been published in the official journal “[[Latvijas Vēstnesis]]” in Latvian and English.<ref name=FinalReport>{{cite web|title=Final report of the Parliamentary Committee for Investigating the Actions Taken by the State of Latvia in Assessing the Causes of the Tragedy in Zolitūde on 21 November 2013, Improving the Legislative Framework and Practical Measures to be Taken by the Public Administration and Municipalities in Order to Prevent Recurrence of Similar Tragedies, as well as Mitigating the Consequences of the Tragedy|work=Latvijas Republikas Tiesību Akti|url=https://www.vestnesis.lv/op/2015/220.1}}</ref> In the final report the committee named seven persons as morally and politically responsible for the tragedy: * former Prime Minister, [[Valdis Dombrovskis]]; * former Ministers for Economics, [[Artis Kampars]] and [[Daniels Pavļuts]]; * former state secretaries of the [[Ministry of Economics (Latvia)|Ministry of Economics]], [[Anrijs Matīss]] and [[Juris Pūce]]; * Mayor of [[Riga]], [[Nils Ušakovs]]; * Head of the Riga Construction Board, Inguss Vircavs.<ref name=FinalReport/>
==Protests== A protest movement against the parties involved sprung up after the incident.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106752-aicina-uz-protesta-akcijam-pret-zolitudes-tragedija-iesaistitajiem.htm|title=Aicina uz protesta akcijām pret Zolitūdes traģēdijā iesaistītajiem|date=26 November 2013|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=1 December 2013}}</ref> Maxima stores were boycotted due in part to statements by its management after the shopping centre's roof collapsed, and also due to reports of [[exploitation of labour|exploitation of workers]] and poor product quality.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/latvija/106758-maximas-veikaliem-draud-boikots.htm|title="Maximas" veikaliem draud boikots|last=Šteinfelde|first=Ilze|date=27 November 2013|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=1 December 2013}}</ref> Several employees, including those that worked in the collapsed store, told media that they received insufficient safety instructions, fire escape doors were blocked, they were not allowed to leave work without permission even to visit the toilet and would have their pay reduced if they failed to comply. The stores would also keep only a few checkout counters open in order to save money, causing long lines to form, requiring employees to work long hours, while paying the [[minimum wage]]. Maxima was also criticised for apparently intimidating workers to keep them from reporting discrepancies to authorities, talking to media or joining a trade union.<ref name="ir zarks"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lsm.lv/lv/raksts/zinju-analiize/analize/maxima-par-visu-ir-padomats-tikai-ne-par-darbiniekiem.a71308/|title="Maxima": Par visu ir padomāts… tikai ne par darbiniekiem|last=Dzērve|first=Laura|date=3 December 2013|publisher=lsm.lv|accessdate=28 December 2013}}</ref> The company was also accused of lying in the wake of the tragedy for initially denying owning the building and for saying that their safety instructions, which required evacuation only when it had been verified there was obvious danger, had been approved by the State Fire and Rescue Service<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lsm.lv/lv/raksts/zinju-analiize/analize/de-facto-maximas-melu-apkopojums.a71208/|title="De facto": "Maximas" melu apkopojums|last=Bagone|first=Linda|date=1 December 2013|publisher=lsm.lv|accessdate=28 December 2013}}</ref> There also have been protests against Maxima in Lithuania.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nra.lv/pasaule/107057-lietuviesi-uzsak-protesta-akciju-pret-maximu-un-davina-skruves.htm|title=Lietuvieši uzsāk protesta akciju pret "Maximu" un dāvina skrūves|date=1 December 2013|publisher=nra.lv|language=Latvian|accessdate=1 December 2013}}</ref>
==Reactions== The [[Andris Bērziņš (Latvian President)|Latvian president]] stated that the Saturday, Sunday and Monday immediately following the disaster would be days of mourning and sent condolences to Armenia in response to the death of one of its citizens.<ref>{{cite news |title=47 dead, two dozens feared trapped after Latvia mall collapse |publisher=tert.am |date=2013-11-22 |url=http://www.tert.am/en/news/2013/11/22/forty/ |accessdate=24 November 2013}}</ref><ref name="spelmanu nakts">{{cite news|title=Saistībā ar traģēdiju Zolitūdē atcelta 'Spēlmaņu nakts' ceremonija |language=Latvian |location=Latvia |publisher=DELFI |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.lv/kultura/news/theatre/saistiba-ar-tragediju-zolitude-atcelta-spelmanu-nakts-ceremonija.d?id=43839112 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Traģēdijas dēļ atcelta virkne kultūras pasākumu |language=Latvian |location=Latvia |publisher=DELFI |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://www.delfi.lv/kultura/news/culturenvironment/tragedijas-del-atcelta-virkne-kulturas-pasakumu.d?id=43839164 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
The Mayor of Riga [[Nils Ušakovs]] said that the Maxima building would be demolished and have a memorial built in its place.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ушаков: здание Maxima снесут, на его месте будет мемориал |language=Russian |location=Latvia |publisher=DELFI |date=23 November 2013 |url= http://rus.delfi.lv/news/daily/latvia/ushakov-zdanie-maxima-snesut-na-ego-meste-budet-memorial.d?id=43841582 |accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>
[[File:2013-11-25 lv.wikipedia.org (SeaMonkey 1.1.19).png|thumb|right|[[Latvian Wikipedia]] with dark logo]] Several Latvian websites, including the [[Latvian Wikipedia|Latvian ''Wikipedia'']], changed their logo designs to include black and images of candles, or put up banners expressing condolences. A black ribbon was also superimposed over the logo of [[Latvijas Televīzija]] during their broadcasts, and was worn by [[anchorman|anchormen]] and anchorwomen. Latvijas Televīzija and other television channels and news website Delfi decided to suspend all commercials from broadcast for the following three days.
Maxima, the owner of the store, ordered all its stores in the Baltic States to observe a period of mourning for three days during which Christmas decorations would not be lit and music would not be played. It also stopped all its advertising.<ref name="Lithuanian delfi"/> Many Latvians were upset that Maxima commercials were still being broadcast on Thursday evening and Friday morning despite the tragedy.
Heeding the call by local hospitals for blood donors, prospective donors waited in a long line at the State Blood Donor Centre on the Friday morning and, after about an hour, the centre thanked donors on Twitter for the overwhelming response and that it had met its collection goals.
A charity drive to help the injured and families of victims was started, which ran for about a month collecting 948263.46 [[Latvian lats|lats]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ziedot.lv/lv/project/1762|title=Atbalsts 21. novembra traģēdijā cietušajiem|publisher=ziedot.lv|accessdate=28 December 2013}}</ref>
Many sports and cultural events, including the ''Spēlmaņu nakts'' annual acting award ceremony, set to take place in the days following the tragedy, were cancelled. The Latvian Minister of Culture, [[Dace Melbārde]], called for cultural organisations, including art and music schools, to consider carefully what events would be appropriate in the circumstances.<ref name="spelmanu nakts"/>
In almost all Latvian embassies, people were allowed to write their names in condolence books. The Latvian Lutheran and Russian Orthodox church organisations urged people to pray for the victims of the tragedy.<ref>{{cite news |location=Latvia |url= http://rus.delfi.lv/news/daily/criminal/cerkov-skorbit-po-pogibshim-v-rezultate-tragedii-v-maxima.d?id=43837584 |title=Церковь скорбит по погибшим в результате трагедии в Maxima |language=Russian |date=21 November 2013 |accessdate=22 November 2013 |publisher=DELFI}}</ref>
Representatives of Maxima Latvia expressed condolences to the families of the deceased. After an emergency meeting, the board of Maxima promised that inspections would be carried out on all Maxima stores.<ref>{{cite news |title=MAXIMA проведёт проверку всех магазинов сети, компенсации получат все |language=Russian |location=Latvia |publisher=FOCUS |date=22 November 2013 |url= http://ru.focus.lv/biznes/kompanii/maxima-provedet-proverku-vseh-magazinov-seti-kompensacii-poluchat-vse |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
